title: Who's the strongest character LORE X GAMEPLAY
body:
I mean...

Think Nasus real fast..

In a 40 min game he can get like 1k stacks.....

SOooooooooooo

Over a few hundred years?

But who are your picks!!!

replies.body: Nasus's Wither in lore just turns people to dust kek

OH damn..

Niceu ;)

Obviously its {{champion:432}} 

This motherfucker is practically a god and if you want endless stacking then chimes are all you need.
#*BONGGGGG*
Aurelion Sol {{champion:136}}
The slave of the Targonians ;)

I think Soraka could challenge Aurelion for title of strongest.

She can throw stars on people's head, that is kinda cool.
I mean, I always figured {{champion:31}} would eventually get big enough to eat the universe, then basically the universe would become some weird Void hellish dystopian place inside cho's stomach.

######*NOM NOM NOM*
*NOM NOM NOM*

##*NOM NOM NOM*

#*NOM NOM NOM*
{{champion:24}}  real weapon

But but but but..

Ok
{{champion:24}} "Imagine I had a real weapon."

Cul..

Nw imagine getting 1-shot by the guardian of the sands ;0

Alright, first off, Nasus hasn't been stackinh his Q for 'a few hundred years'. He's been stacking his Q for over _several millennia._ He can (and does) kill things with a simple touch of his staff, lore-wise and game-wise. Moving on!
----------------------------------
Looking at Lore alone, Aurelion Sol is obviously on top. There's not much you can do about a star dragon that created the entire _Universe._

After that, it's Nasus, for the reasons above

Then things get fuzzy...Aatrox, Ryze, Cho'Gath, Syndra...any of them could take third place. Then there are the few dozens of champions that are also on the stronger side of the power list...

> [{quoted}](name=Lastboss42,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=zAvyAR0A,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-05-29T15:58:45.135+0000)
>
> Alright, first off, Nasus hasn't been stackinh his Q for 'a few hundred years'. He's been stacking his Q for over _several millennia._ He can (and does) kill things with a simple touch of his staff, lore-wise and game-wise. Moving on!
> ----------------------------------
> Looking at Lore alone, Aurelion Sol is obviously on top. There's not much you can do about a star dragon that created the entire _Universe._
> 
> After that, it's Nasus, for the reasons above
> 
> Then things get fuzzy...Aatrox, Ryze, Cho'Gath, Syndra...any of them could take third place. Then there are the few dozens of champions that are also on the stronger side of the power list...

> [{quoted}](name=I am Pacman,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=zAvyAR0A,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-05-29T17:48:47.916+0000)
>
> Obviously its {{champion:432}} 
> 
> This motherfucker is practically a god and if you want endless stacking then chimes are all you need.

Pretty sure sol/bard are equal on 'top' lore wise, pretty sure a rioter had said something along the lines of them both being god's, but their powers being so extremely different, it'd be kinda apples and oranges.
But if you mix gameplay in, bard wins because of infinite stacking.
Also, Kindred on your list where? They are death. Plus infinite stacking *and* ranged. Nasus actually got weakened in lore update. He's not even completely immortal anymore, basically just a human with a Fullmetal Alchemist style philosopher's stone.

Still going with Cho though, Sol may have made the whole universe (or it's stars anyway), but, eventually, Cho would just eat them all.

>Also, Kindred on your list where? They are death.

Kindred is more like a force of nature than an actual champion. In a way that's kind of hard to explain, they don't actually...count. It's like comparing Caesar, Cleopatra, Ivan the Terrible/Great, Zachary Hudson... and then a tornado.

> [{quoted}](name=EvilMerodach,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=zAvyAR0A,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-05-29T18:57:50.352+0000)
>
> Pretty sure sol/bard are equal on 'top' lore wise, pretty sure a rioter had said something along the lines of them both being god's, but their powers being so extremely different, it'd be kinda apples and oranges.
> But if you mix gameplay in, bard wins because of infinite stacking.
> Also, Kindred on your list where? They are death. Plus infinite stacking *and* ranged. Nasus actually got weakened in lore update. He's not even completely immortal anymore, basically just a human with a Fullmetal Alchemist style philosopher's stone.
> 
> Still going with Cho though, Sol may have made the whole universe (or it's stars anyway), but, eventually, Cho would just eat them all.

I remember a Rioter saying Illaoi's Naga was waaaay stronger than Sol, so theres that.

Not a champion, but still a 'character' in lore, so maybe?

Illaoi is Moses level I believe, before you ask.

Naga and Sol are a team. Sol makes the stars, Naga ~~hentais~~ pushes them around to make orbits n' such.

Then the Dark Stars fuck it all up.

FOUND IT!
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/h5YM39JK-the-strongest-and-weakest-champions-in-the-lore
Non-champ wise goes to Nagakabouros. Actual champion power goes to Bard.
I remember a rioter saying that Mord was the strongest champ lore wise.

Rely?

Compared to a dragon taht created the universe?

okie dokie

Consider that the mist pretty much screws with all of Runeterra and kills a crap ton of people annually (There's even a special time for it). Yorick controls the mist and can spawn endless hordes of little nasties that reflect his power. I think Yorick is pretty high up there, maybe not the most powerful, but definitely up there. He's also got a source of immortality in that little vial on his neck, combined with the mist.
If I was going for the most powerful being, I would have to say, just for the sake of argument, Galio's pretty  strong, especially against magical creatures like Sol or Bard that are being put forth. He also feels no pain and could probably rally all of Demacia behind him.
